articles.headline: A Vote That Flew in the Face of Fear Itself
articles.snippet: On an Election Day in the midst of a devastating pandemic and a clash of competing visions of America, anxiety was the great uniter, and motivator.
articles.abstract: On an Election Day in the midst of a devastating pandemic and a clash of competing visions of America, anxiety was the great uniter, and motivator.
articles.lead_paragraph: [Read more on Joe Biden’s president-elect acceptance speech.]

articles.headline: As States Fall His Way, Biden Vows ‘Every Vote Must Be Counted’
articles.snippet: Joseph R. Biden Jr. picked up victories in Michigan and Wisconsin, giving him an advantageous position, as President Trump prepared legal challenges.
articles.abstract: Joseph R. Biden Jr. picked up victories in Michigan and Wisconsin, giving him an advantageous position, as President Trump prepared legal challenges.
articles.lead_paragraph: [Read our profile of Kamala Harris, the first woman elected U.S. vice president.]
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Alexander Burns

articles.headline: Social Media Companies Survived Election Day. More Tests Loom.
articles.snippet: Twitter, Facebook and YouTube remained on alert as the lack of a clear election result kept the online misinformation flowing.
articles.abstract: Twitter, Facebook and YouTube remained on alert as the lack of a clear election result kept the online misinformation flowing.
articles.lead_paragraph: OAKLAND, Calif. — For months, Twitter, Facebook and YouTube prepared to clamp down on misinformation on Election Day.
articles.byline: By Kate Conger, Mike Isaac and Daisuke Wakabayashi

articles.headline: Fox News Helped Fuel Trump’s Rise. Now It’s Reporting on a Possible Fall.
articles.snippet: The president and his aides have been critical of the cable network that includes some of his most ardent media allies.
articles.abstract: The president and his aides have been critical of the cable network that includes some of his most ardent media allies.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Trump and Fox News have a complicated relationship. Election Day did not help.
articles.byline: By Michael M. Grynbaum and John Koblin

articles.headline: A Split Decision for Democrats
articles.snippet: Weary voters appeared willing to give former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. a chance, but they shied away from putting Democrats in full control of Washington.
articles.abstract: Weary voters appeared willing to give former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. a chance, but they shied away from putting Democrats in full control of Washington.
articles.lead_paragraph: [Joe Biden has won the 2020 U.S. presidential election. Read our story]

articles.headline: Win or Lose, Trump Will Remain a Powerful and Disruptive Force
articles.snippet: Even if he is defeated, he has made clear that he would not shrink from the scene.
articles.abstract: Even if he is defeated, he has made clear that he would not shrink from the scene.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — If President Trump loses his bid for re-election, as looked increasingly likely on Wednesday, it would be the first defeat of an incumbent president in 28 years. But one thing seemed certain: Win or lose, he will not go quietly away.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Xbox Series X and S Review: Microsoft’s New Consoles Are a Good Value. Is That Enough?
articles.snippet: Nice hardware? Check. Fair price? Check. Cool, exclusive games? T.B.D.
articles.abstract: Nice hardware? Check. Fair price? Check. Cool, exclusive games? T.B.D.
articles.lead_paragraph: After seven years, the Microsoft Xbox and Sony PlayStation game consoles are getting big upgrades.
articles.byline: By Brian X. Chen and Mike Isaac
